author: Special Correspondent
text:
Various organs of a brain dead man were harvested at the Manipal Hospitals here on Monday.

While one kidney was transplanted to a patient at the Manipal Hospitals itself, other organs were sent to other hospitals.

Paul Karunanithi (47), Headmaster of a Government School at Kallakurichi in Villupuram, was admitted to Manipal Hospitals on March 5. Doctors, who examined him, found that he had massive intracranial bleeding and his brain had lost its function.

He was declared brain dead on Monday by a team of doctors headed by Ashok kumar, Nephrologist, Chelladurai Pandian, Neuro Surgeon, and Priyadharshini, General Medicine.

The patient’s wife Victoria expressed her willingness for donating her husband’s organs, following which the organs were retrieved.

One of his kidneys was transplanted to a renal disease patient, Venkatesh Ramasamy (48), at Manipal Hospitals Salem.

Another kidney was sent to a private hospital in Coimbatore. The eyes were sent to an eye hospital in Erode, according to a press release issued by V. Jayaraman, Unit Head, Manipal Hospital, Salem.
title: Brain dead man’s organs harvested
